intro: Paracleisthus subgracilis, commonly known as the slender river loach, is a small freshwater fish native to Southeast Asia. It has a slender, elongated body with a silvery coloration and a distinct dark stripe running along its length. This species typically inhabits slow-moving streams and rivers with sandy substrates. It is known for its ability to thrive in low-oxygen environments and is often found in dense vegetation. The plant-like appearance of its body and behavior makes it a popular choice among aquarium enthusiasts.
